summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 10, 2019, concerning the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It shows frantic communication between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel, U.S. Marshals Service (USMS), and the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) as officials try to obtain basic facts about Epstein's death to relay to his defense attorneys and family, while information is being released to the press first.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the emails; reported to have passed away in custody after an apparent suicide attempt, being taken to the hospital.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is reported to have passed away in federal custody after an apparent suicide attempt; he was taken by ambulance to the hospital. The Bureau of Prisons issues a press release before providing basic information to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Communication Breakdown After Epstein's Death
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office expresses frustration over receiving information about Epstein's death from the press before official channels, leading to frantic calls from defense counsel seeking basic facts like time and cause of death.

keyFacts: The emails document the immediate aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in federal custody on August 10, 2019, with initial reports citing an 'apparent suicide attempt.'

There was significant frustration from the U.S. Attorney's Office that the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) issued a public press release about Epstein's death before providing basic factual information to prosecutors.
U.S. Marshals Service (USMS) personnel relayed updates from BOP but noted they lacked specifics, highlighting communication gaps between agencies.
The U.S. Attorney's Office was receiving 'increasingly frantic calls' from Epstein's defense counsel, who were learning information from the press before official updates.
